CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 22, 1957, pg. 3 reads: "Death Drop - Arrows show the course of Thomas Bennett's fatal plungs, following the heroic effort to save his daughter, Deborah's life. Although lucky enough to save the child's life, the father lost his when the porch railing gave way and he fell form the porch, to a mail storage box, to the sidewalk.  There was speculation among witnesses as to whether or not Bennett's weight, or the weakened composition and insecurity of the railing was the cause of the death drop. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Man standing in doorway of S. Laby's Superette store, with broken second story porch railing, site of Thomas Bennett's fatal accident
